combined_text: SHL Verify Interactive - Inductive Reasoning. Evaluates ability to identify specific patterns in data or situations and generalize that information to broader contexts. Test Type: A S, Duration: 20
llm_summary: SHL Verify Interactive assesses inductive reasoning skills (pattern identification and generalization).  Test type: A S. Duration: 20 minutes.

combined_text: SHL Verify Interactive – Deductive Reasoning. Measures the ability to draw logical conclusions based on information provided, identify strengths and weaknesses of arguments, and complete scenarios using incomplete information. Test Type: A S, Duration: 20
llm_summary: SHL Verify Interactive assesses deductive reasoning skills (drawing logical conclusions, identifying argument strengths/weaknesses, completing scenarios).  Test type: A (presumably Aptitude), Duration: 20 minutes.

combined_text: SHL Verify Interactive – Numerical Reasoning. Assesses how the candidate comprehends numerical information in various formats. Test Type: A S, Duration: 20
llm_summary: SHL Verify Interactive Numerical Reasoning test assesses numerical comprehension skills.  Test type: Adaptive. Duration: 20 minutes.

combined_text: SHL Verify Interactive G+. SHL Verify Interactive G+ (SVIG+) is a test of general cognitive ability that also generates accurate assessments of three specific abilities: Deductive Reasoning, Inductive Reasoning, and Numerical Reasoning. The candidate will see questions measuring all three abilities. Candidates will receive a score on each of the specific abilities as well as a general ability score. This test is appropriate for all job levels, however it is most relevant for positions that require cognitive ability across a range of specific skills. Completion time is 36 minutes for the test itself, plus 10 minutes for instructions and practice. Test Type: A, Duration: 36
llm_summary: The SHL Verify Interactive G+ (SVIG+) is a 36-minute general cognitive ability test assessing deductive, inductive, and numerical reasoning.  It provides scores for each specific ability and an overall general ability score.

combined_text: SHL Verify Interactive Numerical Calculation. The Verify Interactive Numerical Calculation test measures a candidate’s ability to work with numbers and use appropriate mathematics in different situations. The Numerical Ability test requires candidates to understand order of operations, perform numerical calculations, and identify errors in calculations. The Numerical Calculation test, though it is adaptive, is ideal for entry-level jobs that require completing simple numerical calculations quickly and accurately. Test Type: A, Duration: 10
llm_summary: The SHL Verify Interactive Numerical Calculation test assesses numerical ability and calculation accuracy.  Key skills include order of operations and error identification. Test type: A. Duration: 10 minutes.

combined_text: Siebel Development (New). Multi-choice test that measures the knowledge of Siebel basics, architecture server administration, access control, Siebel client and web applications, Siebel models, data mapping, workflow and deployment. Test Type: K, Duration: 8
llm_summary: This is a knowledge-based (K) multiple-choice Siebel development assessment.  It covers Siebel basics, architecture, administration, access control, client/web applications, models, data mapping, workflow, and deployment. Duration: 8 minutes.

combined_text:
Smart Interview Live. SHL Live Video Interview is a real-time video interview tool. It allows recruiters and line managers to remotely engage with candidates and reach hiring decisions faster. Delight shortlisted candidates with a face2face digital interview that goes way beyond a conference call. Interact with whiteboards, instant file-sharing, draw from an expertly-curated question bank and provide a remote end-to-end interview experience that increases your chance of conversion.

Language Availability The Candidate and Assessor interface is available in US English, Japanese, Simplified Chinese, Castilian Spanish, Portuguese, Brazilian Portuguese, French, Canadian French, Italian, Dutch, Latin American Spanish, Romanian, Indonesian, German, Arabic, Greek. The Admin interface is available in US English and Simplified Chinese (CN server). Test Type: P, Duration: Variable
llm_summary: The SHL Live Video Interview is a real-time video interview (Test Type: P, flexible duration) assessing communication and interaction skills using tools like whiteboards and file-sharing.  Multiple languages are supported.

combined_text:
Smart Interview Live Coding. Smart Interview Live Coding is a real-time online coding interview, with a compiler interface. It enables one-to-one, panel and group interviews. Use Smart Interview Live Coding to comprehensively evaluate candidates’ skills across various technical roles and hire the best coding talent.

The language availability for the candidate and interviewer interface is English (US), Simplified Chinese, Castilian Spanish, Japanese. Please note that the questions themselves are available as standard in US English only.

The language availability for the admin interface is US English only. Test Type: K, Duration: Variable
llm_summary: Smart Interview Live Coding is a flexible duration, online coding assessment (Type K) evaluating candidates' coding skills via a real-time compiler interface.  It supports one-to-one, panel, and group interviews in multiple languages (candidate/interviewer interfaces).  Questions are in US English only.

combined_text:
Smart Interview On Demand. Smart Interview On Demand is a recorded (asynchronous) video interview tool, that introduces you to each person behind the resume with a short-recorded video of them explaining why they would be an awesome addition to your team. A streamlined, minimum bias screening to ensure you shortlist top talent faster and find those hidden gems you may have otherwise missed.

Availability
The administrator and evaluator interface is available in US English and Simplified Chinese only, as are the standard question banks. However, custom questions can be added or recorded in any language.
The participant interface is available in: Arabic, Brazilian Portuguese, Bulgarian, Canadian French, Chinese, Croatian, Czech, Danish, Dutch, Dutch (Belgium), Estonian, Finnish, French, German, Greek, Hindi, Hungarian, Italian, Indonesian, Japanese, Korean, Latvian, Lithuanian, Malaysian, Mexican Spanish, Norwegian, Polish, Portuguese, Romanian, Russian, Serbian, Slovak, Slovenian, Spanish, Swedish, Taiwanese Chinese, Thai, Turkish, UK English, Ukrainian, US English, Vietnamese.

Your use of this assessment product may be subject to New York City Law 144 (Regulation of the Use of Automated Employment Decision Tools) (dated July 5, 2023). Compliance with Law 144 is your responsibility. Read more on https://www.shl.com/legal/shl-us-regulatory-compliance/ Test Type: P, Duration: Variable
llm_summary: Smart Interview On Demand is a flexible duration, asynchronous video interview assessment.  It uses recorded video introductions and questions (customizable in any language) to screen candidates, minimizing bias.  Key skills assessed depend on custom questions; the platform itself supports multilingual interaction.

combined_text: Social Media (New). Multi-choice test that measures the knowledge about the different social media platforms. Test Type: K, Duration: 10
llm_summary: This is a 10-minute, multiple-choice knowledge test assessing understanding of various social media platforms.

combined_text: Software Business Analysis. The Software Business Analysis test measures ability to acquire and understand business requirements for an IT project, develop technical assets in support of that project, and execute such a project in an optimal strategic manner. Designed for senior-level technical professionals, this test covers the following topics: Business Process, Diagramming and Modeling, Documentation, Joint Application Development, Methodologies and Tools, Project Development, Requirements Gathering, System Design, and User Interface. Test Type: K, Duration: 30
llm_summary: This 30-minute Knowledge (K) test assesses senior-level technical professionals' software business analysis skills.  It covers business process, diagramming, documentation, JAD, methodologies/tools, project development, requirements gathering, system design, and user interface.

combined_text: SonarQube (New). Multi-choice test that measures the knowledge of SonarQube, integration tests, Sonar symbols, wildcards, quality cover and Sonar architecture. Test Type: K, Duration: TBC
llm_summary: SonarQube knowledge assessment.  Multi-choice test covering SonarQube features (integration tests, symbols, wildcards, quality cover, architecture).  Test Type: K. Duration: Flexible duration.

combined_text: Spelling (U.S.) (New). Multi-choice test that measures the knowledge of correct spellings in English and the ability to identify spelling errors in sentences. Test Type: K, Duration: 0
llm_summary: This is a flexible duration, multiple-choice spelling test (U.S. English) assessing knowledge of correct spellings and error identification.

combined_text: Split Screen Typing Test - Form 1. This test measures speed and accuracy in typing text presented on the computer screen. In this assessment, the text original is displayed directly above the area in which the test taker must enter the response. The test taker will not need a printed original for the evaluation. This test calculates a score based on the total number of keystrokes, time taken, and number of errors made when typing six passages. This Split Screen Typing Test uses the following method to determine the Net Words Per Minute score: Net Words Per Minute = ((Gross Words Per Minute * Time Taken) - Total Errors) / Time Taken. Test Type: A K, Duration: 6
llm_summary: This Split Screen Typing Test (Form 1) assesses typing speed and accuracy.  Candidates type six passages displayed on a split screen, with a score calculated from keystrokes, time, and errors.  The test type is A K, and the duration is 6 minutes.

combined_text: Spring (New). Multi-choice test that measures the knowledge of Spring core, AOP, IOC container and transactions. Test Type: K, Duration: 9
llm_summary: This is a 9-minute, multiple-choice knowledge test assessing Spring framework expertise, specifically core concepts, AOP, IOC container, and transactions.

combined_text: SQL (New). Multi-choice test that measures the knowledge of SQL queries, data manipulation and transaction processing. Test Type: K, Duration: 9
llm_summary: This is a 9-minute, multiple-choice knowledge test (Type K) assessing SQL skills in querying, data manipulation, and transaction processing.

combined_text: SQL Server (New). Multi-choice test that measures the knowledge of basic SQL queries, creating and altering tables, filtering, grouping, aggregation in SQL and querying multiple tables. Test Type: K, Duration: 11
llm_summary: This is a knowledge-based (K) multiple-choice SQL Server assessment (new) testing basic SQL skills including querying, table manipulation, filtering, grouping, aggregation, and joins.  Duration: 11 minutes.

combined_text: SQL Server Analysis Services (SSAS) (New). Multi-choice test that measures the knowledge of SSAS database, querying multidimensional analysis solutions, cube hierarchies, measures, dimensions, power BI, DAX, MDX, tabular model data access and security. Test Type: K, Duration: 15
llm_summary: This is a 15-minute, multiple-choice knowledge test (Type K) assessing skills in SSAS databases, multidimensional analysis (using MDX and DAX), cube design (hierarchies, measures, dimensions), Power BI integration, and tabular model data access/security.

combined_text: SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) (New). Multi-choice test that measures the knowledge of SSIS architecture, components, control flow, data flow, transformation, SQL server tasks, SSIS administration, debugging, logging, security deployment, performance, package scheduling, execution and configuration. Test Type: K, Duration: 10
llm_summary: This is a 10-minute, multiple-choice knowledge test (Type K) assessing SSIS skills.  It covers architecture, components, control flow, data flow, transformations, tasks, administration, debugging, logging, security, deployment, performance, scheduling, execution, and configuration.

combined_text: SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) (New). Multi-choice test that measures the knowledge of SSRS architecture, report creation, formatting, calculations, creating matrix reports and charts, grouping, sorting, report parameters, report management and security. Test Type: K, Duration: 10
llm_summary: This is a 10-minute, multiple-choice knowledge test (Type K) assessing SQL Server Reporting Services (SSRS) skills.  It covers architecture, report creation, formatting, calculations, matrix reports, charts, grouping, sorting, parameters, management, and security.

combined_text: Statistical Analysis System (New). Multi-choice test that measures the ability to use the SAS software for statistical analysis. Test Type: K, Duration: 11
llm_summary: Statistical Analysis System (New). Multi-choice test that measures the ability to use the SAS software for statistical analysis. Test Type: K, Duration: 11

llm_summary: This is a 5-minute multiple-choice knowledge test assessing Struts framework expertise, including configuration, validations, actions, and interceptors.

llm_summary: This is a knowledge (K) type, multiple-choice Tableau assessment (8 minutes duration) evaluating skills in data preparation, visualization, calculation, filtering, and forecasting.

llm_summary: Telecommunications Engineering knowledge test (Type K) assessing analog, digital communication, electromagnetism, and microwave engineering.  Duration: 7 (units unspecified).

Test Type: K, Duration: 9
llm_summary: This is a 9-minute, multiple-choice knowledge test (Type K) assessing Teradata development skills.  It covers RDBMS components, performance, utilities, workload management, SQL optimization, database design, and indexing.

combined_text: Time Management (U.S.). This is an adaptive test that measures the candidate's knowledge of how to use time wisely in the workplace. It is designed for the average business worker and covers the following topics: Action Plans, Controlling, Decision Making, Organizing, Planning, Scheduling, Time Usage, and Time Wasters. Test Type: K, Duration: 15 to 35
llm_summary: This adaptive knowledge test (Type K) assesses time management skills in a workplace context, covering action planning, controlling, decision-making, organizing, scheduling, and time usage/wasters.  Duration: 15-35 minutes.

combined_text: Training Development. The Training Development test measures knowledge of developing and delivering training programs. Designed for experienced trainers, this test covers the following topics: Analysis Methods, Audience Analysis, Design Materials, Design Strategy, Developing Instructional Materials, General Knowledge, Media, Project Management Plan, Purpose of Training, Training Delivery, and Writing Instructional Objectives. Test Type: K, Duration: 15 to 35
llm_summary: This Training Development assessment (Type K) tests knowledge of training program development and delivery.  It covers analysis, design, materials, delivery, and project management.  Duration: 15 to 35 minutes.

combined_text: Typing (New). Typing based test that evaluates typing speed and accuracy. Test Type: S, Duration: 2
llm_summary: Typing speed and accuracy assessment. Test type: Speed. Duration: 2 minutes.

combined_text: UiPath RPA Development (New). Multi-choice test that measures the knowledge on UiPath architecture, workflows recording, UI interaction, automation, and orchestrator. Test Type: K, Duration: 8
llm_summary: This is a knowledge (K-type) multiple-choice test assessing UiPath RPA development skills, covering architecture, workflow recording, UI interaction, automation, and orchestrator. Duration: 8 minutes.

combined_text: Universal Competency Framework Interview Guide. The UCF Interview Guide provides a structured way of gathering information about each candidate and their competency potential across the 20 UCF Dimensions. NOTE: Simplified Chinese Guide is available from local office; Portuguese Guide is available from Distributor Test Type: C P, Duration: unknown
llm_summary: This is a competency-based interview (C P) assessing 20 UCF dimensions.  Duration is flexible.

combined_text: Universal Competency Framework Job profiling guide. The SHL Universal Competency Framework establishes a common language for competencies that underpins SHL’s products and services. It is a single underlying construct framework that provides a rational, consistent and practical basis for the purpose of understanding people’s behaviours at work and the likelihood of being able to succeed in a given role and in a given environment Test Type: C P, Duration: Untimed
llm_summary: This SHL assessment uses a competency framework to profile job candidates.  Test type: Competency (CP). Duration: Flexible duration.

combined_text: Universal Competency Framework Profiler Cards (44). The UCF sets out the key behaviours that drive performance using a standard, proven hierarchy that can be applied to virtually any job at any level, in any organisation around the world. Test Type: C P, Duration: Untimed
llm_summary: This untimed competency assessment (CP type) uses 44 Profiler Cards based on the Universal Competency Framework (UCF).  It assesses key performance behaviours applicable across various jobs and organizations.  Duration: Flexible.

combined_text: UNIX (New). Multi-choice test that measures the knowledge on the concepts of UNIX commands, file system, file handling, regular expression, awk programming and shell programming. Test Type: K, Duration: 9
llm_summary: This is a knowledge-based (K) multiple-choice test assessing UNIX skills (commands, file system, file handling, regular expressions, awk & shell programming).  Duration: 9 minutes.

combined_text: VB.NET (New). Multi-choice test that measures the knowledge on the concepts of VB.NET assemblies, OOPs concepts, ADO.NET, multithreading, exception handling and GUI. Test Type: K, Duration: 10
llm_summary: This is a 10-minute, multiple-choice knowledge test (Type K) assessing VB.NET skills in assemblies, OOP, ADO.NET, multithreading, exception handling, and GUI.

combined_text: Verify - Deductive Reasoning. The Verify Deductive Reasoning Test is an online ability assessment that can be used to support both pre- and post-hire assessment processes. It enables organisations to recruit and develop candidates applying for jobs at all levels that require deductive reasoning ability. The Deductive Reasoning Test is a new test in the SHL Verify range of ability tests, and measures the ability to: • draw logical conclusions based on information provided • identify strengths and weaknesses of arguments • complete scenarios using incomplete information The test is 18 minutes long, has 20 items and is designed to provide an indication of how an individual will perform when asked to develop solutions when presented with information and draw sound conclusions from data. This form of reasoning is commonly required to support work and decision-making in many different types of jobs and at many levels. Sample tasks for jobs that may require deductive reasoning include, but are not limited to: • evaluate arguments • analyse scenarios • draw logical conclusions Test Type: A, Duration: 20
llm_summary: The SHL Verify Deductive Reasoning Test is a 18-minute, 20-item online assessment measuring the ability to draw logical conclusions, identify argument strengths/weaknesses, and complete scenarios with incomplete information.  It assesses deductive reasoning skills relevant to various job levels.

combined_text: Verify - Following Instructions. This test measures a candidate's ability to follow detailed instructions and then select the correct course of action. Candidates are presented with a set of rules and need to choose the appropriate response for various situations based on the rules given. Test Type: A, Duration: 8
llm_summary: This Verify test assesses the ability to follow detailed instructions and apply rules to choose correct actions.  Test Type: A, Duration: 8 minutes.

combined_text: Verify - G+. The G+ test is part of the Verify suite of cognitive ability tests. The test is designed to measure three types of ability: Numerical, Deductive, and Inductive. There are 30 questions in the test, with 10 questions for each of the three abilities measured. Sample tasks for jobs that may require these abilities include, but are not limited to: evaluating arguments, analyzing scenarios, working with data, doing mathematical computations, interpreting graphs and tables, and drawing logical conclusions. The G+ test, due to its adaptive nature, is appropriate for all job levels and roles. Test Type: A, Duration: 36
llm_summary: The Verify G+ test assesses numerical, deductive, and inductive reasoning abilities via 30 questions (10 per ability).  It's an adaptive Type A test with a 36-minute duration.

combined_text: Verify - General Ability Screen. The General Ability Screen is a first for us – a measure of general mental ability or ‘g’ . Targeted at ‘entry-level’ roles, General Ability Screen is intended to precede other measures to provide process efficiency, and to ensure candidates experience the most positive possible assessment process, by being quick, fair and available as an online test 24/7/365. As the name suggests, the test is designed to be used in screening or sifting processes Test Type: A, Duration: 10
llm_summary: The Verify General Ability Screen is a 10-minute online aptitude test assessing general mental ability ("g").  Designed for entry-level roles, it's used for initial screening to improve efficiency and candidate experience.  Test Type: A. Duration: 10 minutes.

combined_text: Verify - Inductive Reasoning (2014). Inductive Reasoning is a test used for job candidates applying to jobs at all levels that require logical reasoning ability. Sample tasks for jobs that may require inductive reasoning include, but are not limited to dealing with new concepts and approaches, answering questions of ‘why’ and ‘how’ and resolving complex and ambiguous problems. Potential job titles that use this ability are Senior Sales, Product/Service Development, Research and Development. Test Type: A, Duration: 24
llm_summary: The Verify Inductive Reasoning test (Type A, 24 minutes) assesses logical reasoning skills crucial for roles like Senior Sales, Product Development, and Research & Development.  It involves tasks requiring problem-solving and understanding complex concepts.

combined_text: Verify - Numerical Ability. The next-generation Verify Numerical Ability Test provides a replacement for the existing Numerical Reasoning test in our Verify range of ability tests and the Global Cognitive Index – Adaptive Quantitative test, and measures the ability to: • Derive the numerical problem from a written problem • Calculate the answer to numerical equations • Work with numerical data in a realistic workplace context The test is 20 minutes long, has 16 items and is designed to provide an indication of how an individual will perform when asked to work with numerical information or statistical details. Test Type: A, Duration: 20
llm_summary: The Verify Numerical Ability Test (Test Type A, 20 minutes) assesses skills in deriving numerical problems from text, calculating equations, and working with workplace numerical data.  It contains 16 items.

combined_text: Verify - Technical Checking - Next Generation. The Technical Checking assessment is part of the Verify suite of cognitive ability assessments. Technical Checking measures perceptual speed and accuracy. This assessment requires examinees to quickly and accurately match symbols and switches based on a given set of rules. The Technical Checking assessment is mostly non-verbal and features shapes and figures. As with all assessments included in the Verify suite, the Technical Checking assessment allows organizations to assess this aspect of cognitive ability in an unproctored setting. This assessment is appropriate for all job levels and job titles, but is especially relevant for jobs that require the ability to quickly assess the accuracy of information against a set of rules. Test Type: A, Duration: 5
llm_summary: The Verify Technical Checking assessment (Test Type A, flexible duration) measures perceptual speed and accuracy.  It uses a non-verbal format with shapes and symbols, requiring examinees to match them based on rules.  Suitable for all job levels, it's particularly relevant for roles needing quick, accurate information assessment.

combined_text: Verify - Verbal Ability - Next Generation. The Verbal Ability test measures the ability to read written passages and comprehend the text, interpret tone and author intent, identify main ideas, and predict author responses. Sample tasks for jobs that may require verbal ability include, but are not limited to: working with reports, correspondence, instructions, and research information. The Verbal Ability test, due to its adaptive nature, is appropriate for all job levels and roles. Test Type: A, Duration: 15 minutes
llm_summary: This Verify Verbal Ability test (Type A) assesses reading comprehension, interpretation, and identification of main ideas.  It's adaptive and has a 15-minute duration.

combined_text: Verify - Working with Information. This test measures a candidate's ability to process information. Candidates are given information in different table formats and are asked to use the information provided to answer related questions. Test Type: A, Duration: 10
llm_summary: This Verify test assesses information processing skills using table data.  Test Type A, Duration: 10 minutes.

combined_text: Verify G+ - Ability Test Report. The SHL Verify G+ Ability Test Report provides the candidate's overall General Ability score alongside scores on Numerical, Deductive and Inductive Reasoning, using the comparison group selected by the user. Test Type: A, Duration: unknown
llm_summary: The SHL Verify G+ is an ability test assessing numerical, deductive, and inductive reasoning, providing an overall general ability score.  Test type: A. Duration: flexible duration.

combined_text: Verify G+ - Candidate Report. The SHL Verify G+ Ability Candidate Report provides the candidate with feedback on their Numerical, Deductive and Inductive Reasoning results. It does not include the overall score, as it is intended for feedback and developmental purposes. The report focuses on how the candidate can improve their abilities in each area (deductive, inductive, and numerical). Please note: language availability for the G+ Candidate Report is currently more limited than for the manger-facing G+ Ability Report. Test Type: A, Duration: unknown
llm_summary: This SHL Verify G+ Ability test assesses numerical, deductive, and inductive reasoning skills.  It's a Type A test with a flexible duration, providing individual feedback for improvement but no overall score.

combined_text: Verify Interactive Ability Report. Verify Interactive Ability Report Test Type: A, Duration: unknown
llm_summary: This is a Type A interactive ability assessment of flexible duration, evaluating interactive skills.

combined_text: Verify Interactive G+ Candidate Report. Verify Interactive G+ Candidate Report Test Type: A, Duration: unknown
llm_summary: This is a Type A Verify Interactive G+ Candidate Report assessment of flexible duration, evaluating unspecified skills.

combined_text: Verify Interactive G+ Report. Report for Verify Interactive G+ Test Type: A, Duration: unknown
llm_summary: Verify Interactive G+ Test (Type A) assesses unspecified skills with a flexible duration.

combined_text: Verify Interactive Process Monitoring. The SHL Verify Range of Ability Tests is a suite of cognitive ability assessments appropriate for candidates at a wide range of job levels. The SHL Process Monitoring assessment is designed for candidates in a wide range of industries where following processes, ensuring vigilance and maintaining machinery are important aspects of the job role. It measures candidates' ability to respond in a timely manner to instrument feedback and monitor variations in a production process in order to maintain the process within specified safe control limits. Test Type: A, Duration: 18
llm_summary: The SHL Verify Process Monitoring test (Type A, 18 minutes) assesses candidates' ability to monitor processes, maintain vigilance, and respond to instrument feedback within specified limits.  It's suitable for various industries requiring process adherence.

combined_text:
Virtual Assessment and Development Centers. SHL’s innovative virtual assessment centers wow new hires or existing employees and show how you invest in your people. They are a highly engaging experience, inclusive and packed with predictive power to undercover potential. SHL’s virtual assessment and development center platform is packaged with features to support your candidates, assessors and center administrators. Deliver a full range of assessment center exercises, from inbox simulations and written analysis, through coaching and role-play with preparation materials and one to one live virtual interactions, to assigned or unassigned role group exercises. Exercises are available across a range of job levels and industry scenarios Want to find out more or book a demo? Visit https://www.shl.com/en/solutions/virtual/virtual-assessment-development-center/

Language Availability for the candidate and assessor simulation interface is shown in the list below.

Language Availability for the live interactions interface (Smart Interview Live) is currently: English US, Japanese, Simplified Chinese, Spanish, Portuguese, Brazilian Portuguese, French, Canadian French, Italian, Dutch, Latin American Spanish, Romanian, Indonesian, German, Greek. Test Type: P, Duration: unknown
llm_summary: SHL's virtual assessment centers use a flexible duration,  gamified platform to evaluate candidates via simulations (inbox, written analysis, role-play), coaching, and live interactions.  The assessment covers a range of job levels and industries.  The test type is P.

combined_text: Visual Basic for Applications (New). Multi-choice test that measures the knowledge of VBA programming constructs, forms, controls and VBA security. Test Type: K, Duration: 7

combined_text: Workplace Health and Safety (New). Multi-choice test that measures the knowledge of first aid, emergency safety measures, cleanliness and personal hygiene. Test Type: K, Duration: 9
llm_summary: This is a knowledge-based (K) multiple-choice Workplace Health and Safety assessment covering first aid, emergency procedures, cleanliness, and hygiene.  Duration: 9 minutes.

combined_text:
WriteX - Email Writing (Managerial) (New). Open response test that evaluates the ability to write proper emails in English. The test provides scores on content, grammar and email etiquette.

Your use of this assessment product may be subject to New York City Law 144 (Regulation of the Use of Automated Employment Decision Tools) (dated July 5, 2023). Compliance with Law 144 is your responsibility. Read more on https://www.shl.com/legal/shl-us-regulatory-compliance/ Test Type: S, Duration: 15
llm_summary: WriteX assesses managerial email writing skills in English via an open-response test.  It scores content, grammar, and etiquette. Test type:  S; Duration: 15 minutes.

combined_text: Written English v1. The Written English test measures knowledge of US English grammar and English reading comprehension. It is designed for those with English as a second language and covers the following topics: Articles, Comparisons, Conjunctions, General Questions, Misused Words, Nouns, Parallel Structure, Prepositions, Pronouns, Specific Questions, and Verbs. Test Type: K, Duration: 30
llm_summary: The Written English v1 test (Type K, 30 minutes) assesses US English grammar and reading comprehension, covering articles, comparisons, conjunctions, nouns, pronouns, verbs, and more.  It's designed for ESL learners.

combined_text: Written Spanish. This test measures knowledge of Spanish grammar and Spanish reading comprehension skills. Designed primarily for individuals where Spanish is their second language, this test covers the following topics: Adjectives, Adverbs, Conjunctions, Nouns, Prepositions, Pronouns, Verbs, and Reading Comprehension. Test Type: K, Duration: 22
llm_summary: This 22-minute Knowledge (K) test assesses Spanish grammar and reading comprehension skills for second-language learners.  It covers adjectives, adverbs, conjunctions, nouns, prepositions, pronouns, verbs, and reading comprehension.

combined_text: Zabbix (New). Multi-choice test that measures the knowledge of Zabbix architecture, data handling, monitoring and administration. Test Type: K, Duration: 9
llm_summary: This is a 9-minute, multiple-choice knowledge test assessing Zabbix architecture, data handling, monitoring, and administration.

combined_text: 360 Digital Report. Introducing the new 360 Digital Report from SHL! Our latest offering revolutionizes the reporting experience for our 360 products, catering to the modern user's needs for enhanced usability and actionable insights. With a sleek, interactive interface, this report provides a exploration of feedback data, focusing on user development and comprehensive evaluation. Users can now enjoy a visually engaging experience, with the capability to download the report in PDF format for offline access. Upgrade your reporting experience today with SHL's innovative 360 Digital Report! Test Type: D, Duration: unknown
llm_summary: The SHL 360 Digital Report is a flexible duration, Type D assessment providing interactive feedback data visualization for user development and evaluation.  It offers a downloadable PDF.

combined_text: 360° Multi-Rater Feedback System (MFS). SHL 360, or the Multi-Rater Feedback System (‘MFS’), provides a holistic 360-degree view of an employee by gathering feedback from the employee’s manager, peers, direct reports, and/or other raters. By offering a wide range of perspectives, 360 feedback gives employees a more thorough understanding of not only their strengths, weaknesses, and development opportunities, but also their impact on others. 360-degree multi-rater assessments are based on SHL’s Universal Competency Framework (“UCF”), using our proven library of research-driven competencies to provide opportunities for managers, peers, and direct reports to supply useful developmental feedback that they may not otherwise share. SHL can also offer support and training throughout the entire process, from defining objectives through interpreting and delivering the feedback. 360 feedback serves all levels and industries and is a positive and powerful addition to your performance management system. Test Type: D P, Duration: Untimed
llm_summary: The SHL 360 Multi-Rater Feedback System (MFS) is a 360-degree assessment using SHL's Universal Competency Framework.  It gathers feedback from multiple sources (manager, peers, direct reports) to provide a holistic view of employee strengths, weaknesses, and development areas.  Test type: Developmental (DP), Duration: Flexible duration.
